Name: Nestle 1904
Description: Text of the Nestle 1904 Greek New Testament posted by Diego Santos.

Name: Nestle 1904
Description: Text of the Nestle 1904 Greek New Testament posted by Diego Santos. Clean XML markup.

Name: SBLGNT
Description: High quality critical text created by Logos Software and the Society of Biblical Literature. Note the license, which imposes conditions on downstream works that use it.

Name: Robinson-Pierpoint Byzantine text
Description: Robinson-Pierpont edition of the Greek New Testament in the Original Greek, Byzantine Majority Text.

Name: Bunning Heuristic Prototype (BHP)
Description: The BHP uses a reasoned eclecticism method to approximate the results of a computer-generated algorithm which weighs earliness and reliability of witnesses based solely on the CNTR collation of every known extant Greek manuscript containing portions of the New Testament up to year 400 AD

Name: Codex Sinaiticus
Description: TEI transcription of Codex Sinaiticus.

Name: Swete's Septuagint
Description: Machine-corrected OCR scan of Swete's Septuagint.

Name: Migne’s Patrologia Graeca
Description: Massive collection of Church Fathers. See description on Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrologia_Graeca).

Name: Cramer’s Catenae
Description: For each verse, lists any comments that the early Fathers made on that verse.

Name: Sefaria
Description: Midrash, Targums, Talmud, Kabbalah, a lexicon, and a Hebrew grammar.

Name: CNTR Transcriptions
Description: Transcriptions of all New Testament texts (class 1 data) up to the terminus ad quem of 400 AD.

Name: Amsterdam Database of New Testament Conjectural Emendation
Description: New Testament conjectures, which affect textual criticism.

Name: Nestle 1904 Greek New Testament
Description: Nestle 1904 Morphology.

Name: SBLGNT Greek New Testament
Description: SBLGNT, done by MorphGNT, the first initiative to produce truly open high quality morphologies for the Greek New Testament.

Name: Westcott-Hort
Description: Westcott-Hort with morphology, as edited by Joshua Grauman.

Name: Tischendorff Greek New Testament
Description: Tischendorff morphology, done by MorphGNT.

Name: Bunning Heuristic Prototype (BHP)
Description: Bunning Heuristic Prototype, generated from early manuscripts algorithmically.

Name: Rahlf’s Septuagint
Description: Rahlf's Septuagint with morphology.  Note: not freely licensed.

Name: Swete’s Septuagint
Description: An openly licensed morphologically tagged Swete’s Septuagint

Base Text: New Testament, Old Testament, Apocrypha, Various
Name: Coptic Scriptorium
Description: A corpus of Coptic texts.

Name: Shebanq
Description: Morphology and treebank for biblical Hebrew

Name: Nestle 1904 Greek New Testament (GBI)
Description: High quality treebank using HPSG constituent grammar.  Global Bible Initiative trees.

Name: Nestle 1904 Greek New Testament (Lowfat)
Description: Lowfat trees - a simpler and expressive format transformed from GBI trees to make them easier to query.

Name: SBLGNT Greek New Testament (GBI)
Description: High quality treebank using HPSG constituent grammar.  Global Bible Initiative trees.

Name: SBLGNT Greek New Testament (Lowfat)
Description: Lowfat trees - a simpler and expressive format transformed from GBI trees to make them easier to query.

Name: PROIEL
Description: High quality dependency trees in an eclectic and expressive format. Part of a parallel corpus of old Indo-European Bible translations, including Greek, Armenian, Gothic, Old Church Slavonic, and Latin.

Name: Levinsohn’s Greek New Testament Discourse Features
Description: Stephen Levinsohn’s complete discourse features markup of the Greek New Testament (UBS4/NA27). Released by SIL International and Paul O’Rear, and recognized as the 2016 Dataset of the Year.

Name: Abbott-Smith
Description: Probably the best traditional lexicon in the public domain.

Name: Dodson
Description: This lexicon has simple glosses and short definitions. Originally developed by Jeffrey Dodson, released to the public domain.

Name: Liddell-Scott-Jones
Description: The Great Scott, a massive and extremely useful lexicon. This is the version currently used on Perseus, converted to Unicode.

Name: Mounce's Lexicon
Description: Mounce’s Concise Greek-English Dictionary of Biblical Greek.

Name: Shebanq Lexicon
Description: A Hebrew lexicon from the Shebanq project.

Name: Strong's Lexicon
Description: One of the most commonly used lexicons, keyed to Strong’s Numbers for easy cross reference. Greek and Hebrew.

Name: Strong's Lexicon
Description: One of the most commonly used lexicons, keyed to Strong’s Numbers for easy cross reference. Greek and Hebrew.

Name: Jeffrey A. Rydberg-Cox: Overview of Greek Syntax
Description: Extremely useful summaries of Greek syntax, easily integrated into a reading environment.

Name: Ancient Greek Tutorials, by Donald J. Mastronarde
Description: Ancient Greek Tutorials, by Donald J. Mastronarde with the assistance of the Berkeley Language Center of the University of California, Berkeley. ©1999-2005 The Regents of the University of California. Copyright prevents free distribution, but this can be useful for producing resources.

Name: Gesenius
Description: The old classic Hebrew Grammar

Name: Lace
Description: Contains a massive number of Greek texts in hOCR format, including several scholarly commentaries on the Greek text of each New Testament book, Septuagint resources, Cramer’s Catenae, Migne, the Sophocles lexicon, and many other resources that are just begging for the community to adopt and do manual editing.

Base Text: Greek New Testament, Hebrew Old Testament
Name: Bible Support
Description: Contains some very useful commentaries and dictionaries.
